meanings.definition: The capacity of a substance to cause birth defects.
meanings.sent1: The teratogenicity of the medication was a concern for pregnant women.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study teratogenicity to understand how certain substances can harm unborn babies.
meanings.sent3: The teratogenicity of the chemical was so high that even the lab mice refused to go near it.
meanings.sent4: The teratogenicity of the radiation was like a silent danger lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The teratogenicity of the virus was a chilling reminder of the risks pregnant women face.

meanings.definition: The state of being able to produce malformations in a developing embryo or fetus.
meanings.sent1: Doctors warned about the teratogenicity of the new drug during pregnancy.
meanings.sent2: Research focuses on understanding the teratogenicity of various environmental factors.
meanings.sent3: The teratogenicity of the plant extract turned out to be a blessing in disguise for the mutant butterflies.
meanings.sent4: The teratogenicity of the curse was evident in the twisted forms of the cursed children.
meanings.sent5: The teratogenicity of the magic potion transformed the tadpoles into miniature dragons.
